Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Highly Porous Metal Tibia in Total Knee Arthroplasty

Trial_Design.evidence: 397 patients (age 67.8 ± 8.7 years; 54% female) were randomised into three groups

Intervention.evidence: highly porous metal tibia compared to a traditional modular cemented tibia

Objective.evidence: This randomised controlled trial evaluated the effectiveness of a highly porous metal tibia compared to a traditional modular cemented tibia in total knee arthroplasty

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Stratified randomisation was based on surgeon, patient’s age, sex, and body mass index

Number_Analysed.evidence: A per-protocol analysis showed no highly porous metal tibia was revised for aseptic loosening

Result_Outcome.evidence: At 5 years, survivorship was similar across groups (96.8% [1]; 97.6% [2]; 96.7% [3]; p = 0.59)

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were not detailed in the manuscript

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided
